Great cloud storage medium. Works flawlessly on Fedora27, Android and IOS. I have not tested it on other platforms but I am sure that they will work. Great customization and very user friendly. 25GB guaranteed free storage and expandable up to 50GB if certain conditions are met. This is only for a limited time though. Highly recommended.

I think it's pretty cool

description: Install the app, canceled the upload of my data and for some reason after i reboot the PC all my files where gone. My luck is that i ad everything on an external hardrive. Don't use this app.
Don't use this if you regularly download more than 5GB per day, and can't handle yet another subscription. It has a nasty quota limit that you can only remove by paying a monthly fee.

I've been using megasync for more than 2 years, works great, no problems whatsoever.
Would be nice if it integrated better with the GNOME desktop (the megasync app must be open in order to work)

Amazing Cloud storage service with generous free plan.
This version forces three folders to exist in home directory. The official deb version is better.
This Flatpak version FORCES you to sync your files in your home folder. Choosing other locations will fail. The RPM version from their website is so much better.

There is a fundamental flaw with this version of the app. The app is unable to hold the setting to automatically startup when the computer cold boots up or restarts. Additionally this flaw is noticed whenever the app is restarted. The work around I found after speaking with MEGA technical support is not to install this version in the store but rather download the MEGAsync app directly from MEGA's website. I did this and it works fine.
summary: DO NOT USE - App is Flawed - Download Directly from MEGA Instead

description: Currently the app is opening in the tray for a few seconds, then will shut off with no indication of what went wrong. Was working a month or so ago...
recomend, very util

I strongly recommend you to use the DEB/RPM version instead. I know it's a bit of a hassle to go to the website, click a few things and download files and then open them individually, but that's the only way to make it work, unfortunately. Plus, you get the option to install a compatibility layer for your favorite file manager, ain't that nice?

description:
It works fine on Fedora 38 KDE 5.27
I had to manually adjust some system settings:
- Startup and Shutdown > Autostart > Add > MEGAsync
- Application > Flatpak permissions > MEGAsync > All User Files: read/write

description: Works fine, I assume there was an update fixing it at some point recently

even after a fix it seems another valve software update has yet again messed up the function of the UI, although i have found the issue, just the sync part is the one broken and the only issue here is when you click on browse to select a folder to sync the resulting window that pops up (regardless of file choosen) never brings back the main window from backround leaving all control and even the exit button for the window unresponsive making the whole sync partnof the app useless, this could be fixed by simply adding a way to paste folder and file paths directly into the window without even having to open the file browser...

Like other reviewers, I hit the same "freezes solid when trying to pick a local folder" issue. There's a working solution, but you'll have to do some additional steps...
Per https://github.com/flathub/nz.mega.MEGAsync/issues/49 you can do the following:

flatpak update --commit=7f30d8f2998e3376afb64525ae537f392c7b737b6209a13fc29a1610493f418c nz.mega.MEGAsync

You'll need to sudo this, of course. This will downgrade you to a version that actually does let you select folders correctly. It'll work fine after that point, even if you upgrade, but you'll need to downgrade again to choose any new folder pairs.

You should probably also pick up Flatseal and add some additional folder permissions while you're at it, especially if you want to use this with EmuDeck. You WILL hit a brick wall trying to sync GameCube memory cards otherwise, probably other emulators too.

It works fine once you jump through ten thousand hoops, but it's not a fun experience.
Sync fonctionality broken, selecting a folder will crash the app
It froze a lot trying to set up and I couldn't choose a custom folder, but I did verify that the "Mega" folder did sync.
Used to be a great app and a great service. And flatpaks are supposed to run everywhere? Well, this one does not. I will have to download the installation file from mega.nz instead. What a shame.

description: Funciona bien en FEDORA 32

Llevo usando Mega desde hace algunos años y siempre ha funcionado de maravilla, en la versión Flatpak, de forma predeterminada no inicia con el sistema y debes ingresar un comando en los programas de inicio (punto en contra), además no viene el plugin para Nautilus el cual muestra si tus carpetas están sincronizadas de forma gráfica con un visto.

Debido a eso no tiene mis 5 estrellas, pero la aplicación funciona perfectamente.
I lack information explaining why it won't create an account for me.

Hasta l momneto es la mejor aplicación con servicio de nube que he encontrado en Linux, por el espacio que te ofrece, la velocidad de descarga y el aplicativo muy bien hecho.
La cuota de transferencia es muy baja en la cuenta GRATIS, de unos 430 MB, pero creo que es justa para un usuario común.

Muy recomendable.
la aplicación funciona de forma fluida
